description: The file contains utility functions for reading property values from files, reading file content, checking if a path is a regular file, searching files recursively with pattern matching, and expanding variables within strings using property files. It also includes functions for file system operations like directory traversal and regex-based filename filtering.

methods.name: bool readPropertyFromFile(const char * filename,const string & property,string & propertyValue)
methods.description: Reads a property value from a specified file, with support for recursive variable expansion indicated by '$'.

methods.name: bool readFileContent(const char * filename,string & content)
methods.description: Reads the entire content of a specified file into a string.

methods.name: bool isRegularFile(const string & path)
methods.description: Checks if a specified path corresponds to a regular file.

methods.name: bool searchFilesRec(std::vector<std::string> & pathList,unsigned int currentDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Recursively searches for files matching pattern in directories, with support for wildcards and depth limits. Results capped at 10 files.

methods.name: bool searchFiles(string & inputPath,int maxDepth,int minDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Initiates recursive file search starting from an input path with specified max/min depth and exclusions.

methods.name: bool ExpandPropertiesInString(const char * input,const char * filePath,string & expandedString)
methods.description: Expands variable references (denoted by '$') inside a string using property values read from a file.
